title.narrative: LaRRI - Labour Resource and Research Institute

description.narrative: LaRRI is a Namibian research institute. LaRRI conducts research on topics identified as important by the labour movement and community based organisations, supports organisation of domestic workers as a labour and advocacy group, and has education programmes for trade unions. LaRRi works towards improved wages for domestic and farm workers in Namibia and beyond through research, training and advocacy. The targets are to raise the awareness of the value of social justice, and the understanding of the importance and need for an alternative social and economic developmental agenda for Namibia. Regarding the labour movement the targets are enhanced gender equality and improved administrative and financial capacity of trade union leaders and members.

The report on the research on Informal economy that LaRRI authored after conducting data collection on behalf of the Ministry of Labour, Industrial Relations and Employment Creation, together with Social Security Commission was successfully launched in May 2018. How the recommendations in the report will be put forward will be addressed next year.


A report from the research on Gender mainstreaming commissioned by the Ministry of Works and Transport is finalised and ready for publication. The report gives following recommendation; improve the expertise, competence and capacity building of project/programme staff in gender, translate gender equality objectives into action in programming and implementation cycles, improve information and knowledge management within the work unit, ensure that all transport projects/programmes promote gender equality.


As way forward LaRRI wishes to conduct a workshop in the end of 2018 that will be based on the gender and transport study.

33 students from the LaRRI education programme Certificate and Diploma in Labour studies have graduated this year. The majority of the graduates were comprised of union members and workers. This education programme responds directly to LaRRI`s intermediate objective for the overall project on educating at least 50% of union members and workers to ensure that they are knowledgeable about training and accredited education program. An advertisement for the next cycle of the education programme was released. The application is open to both trade unions and the public at large. The first classes for the programme are scheduled to start in August 2018 with English for Academic Purposes. The education modules have been under review since 2016. The Module on English for Academic Purposes was reviewed during this period. Three more modules expected to be reviewed this year are.
